description: Sven Halek decides to broadcast Haldens original spiral blueprint, framing it as a unifying vision for Stenograds renewal. He drafts a message connecting the spirals meaning to collective ascent and dissolving rigid hierarchies.
In a citywide broadcast, Haldens spiral blueprint is unveiled. Svens speech inspires citizens to view the design as a roadmap for a new, participatory society beyond BCI-driven control.
Public forums and rallies spring up around the spiral symbol, with residents gathering to discuss new forms of leadership and shared responsibility inspired by Haldens notes.
Former BCI neighborhoods organize grassroots assemblies, instituting rotating decision-making roles and shared rituals to mark the beginning of collective governance.
On the Night of the Spirals, citizens citywide create murals and share stories, formally dissolving what remains of the old Council and affirming Haldens legacy of open-ended community ascent.
